Serialized Form

  • Package <Unnamed>

    • Class BoardGUI extends javax.swing.JFrame implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • boardPanel

          javax.swing.JPanel boardPanel
          This JPanel serves as the location of all the board components.

        • border

          javax.swing.border.Border border
          This will serve as the button to indicate if something has been selected or highlighted yellow.

        • grid

          javax.swing.JPanel[][] grid
          This 2D array of JPanels serves as the space in each grid in the gridLayout. It will have JButton2D and JLabel2D to occupy it.

        • gridBGs

          JLabel2D[][] gridBGs
          This attribute is a 2D array of JLabel2D. These are the labels that will serve as the background of each JPanel grid, and it's basically the terrain.

        • gridBtns

          JButton2D[][] gridBtns
          This attribute is a 2D array of JButton2D. These are the buttons to press and it will have the images of the animals.

        • infoPanel

          javax.swing.JPanel infoPanel
          This JPanel serves as the location on whose turn is it, if someone has won, and the reset button.

        • resetBtn

          javax.swing.JButton resetBtn
          This would be in the infoPanel and allows the game to be reset and open the randomizer screen.

        • whoTurn

          javax.swing.JLabel whoTurn
          This JLabel would be in the infoPanel and indicates whose turn is it.

        • whoWin

          javax.swing.JLabel whoWin
          This JLabel would be in the infoPanel and indicates if someone has won already.

    • Class JButton2D extends javax.swing.JButton implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • color

          int color
          This variable will indicate what color this JButton2D is.

        • isHighlightedYellow

          boolean isHighlightedYellow
          This variable indicates if this button is highlighted yellow (meaning if this is a spot that can ba taken by an animal).

        • name

          java.lang.String name
          This variable is the string representation of JButton2D.

        • x

          int x
          This variable is the x value for JButton2D (JButton2D[x][]).

        • y

          int y
          This variable is the y value for JButton2D (JButton2D[][y]).

    • Class JLabel2D extends javax.swing.JLabel implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • name

          java.lang.String name
          This variable is the string representation of JLabel2D.

        • x

          int x
          This variable is the x value for JLabel2D (JLabel2D[x][]).

        • y

          int y
          This variable is the y value for JLabel2D (JLabel2D[][y]).

    • Class RandomizerGUI extends javax.swing.JFrame implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • blueBtn

          javax.swing.JButton blueBtn
          This JButton, if pressed, the winning player would be on the Blue side.

        • chooseColor

          javax.swing.JLabel chooseColor
          This JLabel just shows an instruction to the winning player which color do they want to pick: Red (Left) or Blue (Right).

        • doneBtn

          javax.swing.JButton doneBtn
          This JButton, if pressed, will open the Game of Animal Chess. It will initialize BoardGUI, BoardController, Gameboard, and Player classes.

        • p1RanBtns

          javax.swing.JButton[] p1RanBtns
          This attribute is a 2D array of JButtons which will be the array that will consist of the Player 1 randomized buttons.

        • p1Result

          javax.swing.JLabel p1Result
          This attribute is the JLabel in which it will showcase what Player 1 got from the randomized buttons.

        • p2RanBtns

          javax.swing.JButton[] p2RanBtns
          This attribute is a 2D array of JButtons which will be the array that will consist of the Player 2 randomized buttons.

        • p2Result

          javax.swing.JLabel p2Result
          This attribute is the JLabel in which it will showcase what Player 2 got from the randomized buttons.

        • redBtn

          javax.swing.JButton redBtn
          This JButton, if pressed, the winning player would be on the Red side.

        • whoFirst

          javax.swing.JLabel whoFirst
          This attribute is the JLabel that will tell who won the randomizer, which will be the first turn in the game that's about to come.

    • Class TitleGUI extends javax.swing.JFrame implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • startBtn

          javax.swing.JButton startBtn
          This JButton encompasses the start button, which will start the game.

        • title

          javax.swing.JLabel title
          This attribute simply shows the title of the game.
